file_content.text: I've done all I can. I'll alert you if I hear from the admiral.
Satellite's dead. What do your people know about grid alpha nine?
Pirate territory. Heavily fortified.
Can you get me numbers?
Perhaps. But our manpower is limited.
"Manpower." Excuse me.
Captain Leo Furth, Search and Recovery. Saw your docking authorization--you must be our visitor from Intelligence.
Cipher Nine. I'm on unattached wartime duty, here to see Admiral Davos.
That's right.
Come here, Sergeant. What's your name?
Is that another Chiss?
Sergeant Ath'en'terro, Chiss Expansionary Defense Force, permanently attached to Imperial Search and Recovery.
It is an honor to work with our allies in the Empire.
Ah... please excuse us, Sergeant.
I'm not used to seeing foreigners at an Imperial base.
Who's the alien?
Do you have a problem with me, Captain?
You don't sound happy.
No, sir. I just didn't think Intelligence oversight was needed here.
Sergeant, you're dismissed.
Your friends in the Chiss Ascendancy know Hoth pretty well, but friendship only goes so far.
The Chiss Ascendancy has been operating on Hoth for years. Useful, but let's not kid ourselves.
So what's your business with the admiral?
I understand he's leading a team to the starship graveyard. I intend to join him.
I hear there's an expedition.
That information is for the admiral's ears only.
You're not authorized to know.
Then you're out of luck.
So what is it you came here for?
Layek Davos, head of Search and Recovery. Where is he?
I need Admiral Davos.
Ah. The admiral's a good man... but you're out of luck.
There's a vessel in the starship graveyard. The Starbreeze.
It's about this ship...
Don't know it. The admiral might, but your timing's no good.
Starship graveyard is Admiral Davos's field... but your timing's bad.
I don't share that sort of thing with captains. Who's your superior?
You're not authorized to know.
You want Admiral Davos. Served with him for almost ten years, but I'm afraid he's not available.
He left base with his expedition thirty-six hours ago. Long-range comms are almost useless in this weather; you want to wait, he'll be back in a few weeks.
If this were an emergency, how would you reach him?
There must be some way.
Give me his last known location, and I'll be going.
I'll have to follow, then.
Perhaps you can tell that to the Director of Operations yourself.
My superiors won't be happy.
You think I'm holding something back? Check my record. I'm loyal.
Look... there might still be a crew at the expedition launch site. It's where the admiral's supply line to the starship graveyard starts.
But trying to reach the launch point now is suicide. Weather's bad, and there are Republic commandos in the area.
I don't plan to stay out longer than I have to. But Admiral Davos isn't leaving without me.
I'm a survivor.
Understood, sir. I hope you find what you're after.
I expect your cooperation, Captain. Maps, supplies, anything you can provide.
It's your duty to help me.
Yes, sir. Sergeant Thent!
Captain?
Equip our visitor for travel. She'll need all the help she can get.
Equip our visitor for travel. He'll need all the help he can get.
I'm not looking for a suicide mission. Thank you for your time, Captain.
Point taken.
Yes, sir.
Hard vacuum may be colder than Hoth, but at least there's no wind.
